topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Switchtec-Specific Configuration Space Registers

body.p: Switchtec ports (USP and DSP) contain extended capability registers in the type 1 header which store a variety of vendor specific information. This section covers the detailed uses of each vendor-specific field and describes how to use the indirect gas window to perform things from reading GAS information to executing MRPC calls.

section.title: Indirect GAS Access Window (0x0800 - 0x9FF)
section.p: This is a 512 byte window, mapped to GAS based on the "Indirect GAS Access Window Offset" (default 0x0A00 - 0x0A03), (RW)

section.title: Indirect GAS Access Window Offset (0x0A00 - 0x0A03)
section.p: The indirect GAS Access Window is mapped to GAS using this offset, starting with the address of "this value * 512"

section.title: NT Crosslink Link Reset Register (0x0A04)
section.p: NT Crosslink Link Reset is only applicable to the NT Crosslink port when the link is enabled and in L0. An NT Crosslink port is formed when the port is configured as a USP with NT EP and NT Crosslink functionality is checked . NT Crosslink link reset results in a Crosslink port to go disabled and then enabled.

strow.stentry:
NT Crosslink Link Reset
0 - No action
1 - Reset the Crosslink

section.title: Port Event Summary Register (0x0C00 - 0x0C03)
section.p: A set bit means there is a port event in the corresponding event slot

strow.stentry: AER in Virtual Endpoint (Mgmt EP) Occurred

section.note: From this register to the end of CSR region is used for port events. This region is only available for P2P bridge functions that have already bound with a physical port and NT Endpoint with USP Mode = 0x3: NT EP Only, but reserved for other functions.

strow.stentry:
Event Status
0 - No Event
1 - Event Happened
Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register
Fatal Error Event, firmware will stop running
Event counter - number of times since this event is cleared last time

section.title: AER in P2P Event Header Register (0x0C10 - 0x0C13)
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: AER in P2P Event Data Registers (0x0C14 - 0x0C27)

strow.stentry:
AER Source Bit Offset
0-31 - Uncorrectable Error Bit Offset = (Bit offset). Refer to “Uncorrectable Error Status Register” in AER capability to find which error each bit represents
32-63 - Correctable Error Bit Offset = (Bit Offset - 32) Refer to “Correctable Error Status Register” in AER capability to find which error each bit represents
64-66 - Switchtec Specific Additional Error Bit Offset = (Bit Offset - 64)
0 - Ingress Block UR
1 - Egress Block UR
2 - First Link Down
Related TLP Header (applicable when the current uncorrectable error has its TLP header logged, based on PCIE Spec or is a "Switchtec Specific Additional Error"

section.title: AER in vEP Event Header Register (0x0C28 - 0x0C2B)
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: AER in vEP Event Data Registers (0x0C2C - 0x0C3F)

strow.stentry:
AER Source Bit Offset
0-31 - Uncorrectable Error Bit Offset = (Bit offset). Refer to “Uncorrectable Error Status Register” in AER capability to find which error each bit represents
32-63 - Correctable Error Bit Offset = (Bit Offset - 32) Refer to “Correctable Error Status Register” in AER capability to find which error each bit represents
64-66 - Switchtec Specific Additional Error Bit Offset = (Bit Offset - 64)
0 - Ingress Block UR
1 - Egress Block UR
2 - First Link Down
Related TLP Header (applicable when the current uncorrectable error has its TLP header logged, based on PCIE Spec or is a "Switchtec Specific Additional Error"

section.title: DPC Event Header Register: 0x0C40 - 0x0C43
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: DPC Event Data Registers: 0x0C44 - 0x0C57
section.p: Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 8 bytes are valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.

strow.stentry:
AER Reason
0 - Uncorrectable Error
1 - Error Non-Fatal Message
2 - Error Fatal Message
3 - Software Trigger
Source ID, Only available when Trigger Reason is Fatal/Non-Fatal Message

section.title: CTS Event Header Register: 0x0C58 - 0x0C5B
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: CTS Event Data Registers: 0x0C5C - 0x0C6F
section.p: Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 8 bytes are valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.

strow.stentry:
Timeout Reason
1 - TS1 Timed out
2 - CPL Late Arrival
3 - CFG CPL no arrival
4 - CFG CPL late arrival
The first two DWORDs of synthesized completion related to TLP Header

section.title: UEC Event Header Register: 0x0C70 - 0x0C73
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

strow.stentry: Source partition of the TLP that triggered UEC
Source port of the TLP that triggered UEC
Bit[159:32]: The content of 3 DW or 4 DW TLP Header

section.title: Hotplug Event Header Register: 0x0C88 - 0x0C8B
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: Hotplug Event Data Registers: 0x0C8C - 0x0C9F
section.p: Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 1 byte is valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.

strow.stentry:
Hot plug status indicators
0 - Attention LED
1 - Power LED
2 - Power Control
3 - Inter Lock
4 - Attention Button Pressed
5 - Power Fault Detected
6 - MRL Sensor Changed
7 - Presence Detect Changed
8 - Link Status Change

section.title: IER Event Header Register: 0x0CA0 - 0x0CA3
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: IER Event Data Registers: 0x0CA4 - 0x0CB7
section.p: Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 4 bytes are valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved. This register stores the IER Reason Code.

strow.stentry: SP IFB RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
SP RST RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
SC IFB Descriptor RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
SC IFB DATA RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
SC EFB Descriptor RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
SC EFB DATA RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
PL/DLL Replay Buffer RAM 2 Bit ECC Error

section.title: Threshold Reach Event Header Register: 0x0CB8 - 0x0CBB
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: Threshold Reach Event Data Registers: 0x0CBC - 0x0CCF
section.p: Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 4 bytes are valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.

strow.stentry: Unsupported Request Error Enable. This is only for received Completion TLP with Unsupported Request status
Completer Abort Error, this is only for received Completion TLP with Completion Abort status

section.title: Power Management Event Header Register: 0x0CD0 - 0x0CD3
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: Power Management Event Data Registers: 0x0CD4 - 0x0CE7
section.p: Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 1 byte is valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.

section.title: TLP Throttling Event Header Register: 0x0CE8 - 0x0CEB
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: TLP Throttling Event Data Registers: 0x0CEC - 0x0CFF
section.p: Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 1 byte is valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved,

strow.stentry: Bit 0 - PPU FW TLP throttling event
Bit 1 - PPU DB TLP throttling event

section.title: Force Speed Event Header Register: 0x0D00 - 0x0D03
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: Force Speed Event Data Registers: 0x0D04 - 0x0D17
section.p: Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 2 bytes are valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved,

strow.stentry:
D0
0x0001 - Force Gen3 has been set, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen1.
0x0002 - Force Gen3 has been set, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen2.
0x0003 - Force Gen2 has been set, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen1.
0x0004 - Force Max Speed has been set, the device is Gen3 capable, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen1.
0x0005 - Force Max Speed has been set, the device is Gen3 capable, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen2.
0x0006 - Force Max Speed has been set, the device is Gen2 capable, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen1.

section.title: Credit Timeout Event Header Register: 0x0D18 - 0x0D1B
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: Credit Timeout Event Data Registers: 0x0D1C - 0x0D2F
section.p: Reserved

section.title: Link State Change Event Header Register: 0x0D30 - 0x0D33
section.p: See Event Header Registers.

section.title: Link State Change Event Data Registers: 0x0D34 - 0x0D47
section.p: Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first byte is valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.

section.title: MSCC Internal Event Registers: 0x0D48 - 0x0E4F
section.p: Takes up 24 bytes for each event, reserved 11 for MSCC Internal Events.

section.title: Customized Event Registers: 0x0E50 - 0x0EDF
section.p: Takes up 24 bytes for each events, reserved 6 for Customized Events.

section.title: MSCC Internal Extend Event Registers: 0x0EE0 - 0x0FFF
section.p: Takes up 24 bytes for each event.
